# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime, bump::Int = 3)
    if typeof(dt) <: Date
        error("timezone_bumper only works with DateTime types, not Date types")
    end
    return dt + Hour(bump)
end
```

This function uses the `Dates` package in Julia to work with date and time types. It checks if the input `dt` is of type `Date` and throws an error if it is. Otherwise, it adds the specified number of hours to the input `DateTime` object using the `Hour` function from the `Dates` package.
